header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: The text posits that true dominion over life, particularly in the manipulation of time and environment, is achieved through the development of supersensory powers, which are intrinsically linked to Cosmic Consciousness and the understanding of life as a 'Dance of Life'. This dominion is facilitated by disciplined self-control, responsibility, and an internal realization of unity with the Divine.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 53: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson focuses on the mastery of time as a fundamental aspect of dominion, emphasizing punctuality and responsibility in relationships. It introduces the concept of 'dominion' as conscious oneness with the Divine ('Attah') and freedom derived from this unity. The text further links interpersonal inconsiderateness to a lack of understanding of others' viewpoints and the concept of reaping what is sown. It distinguishes between control and repression, advocating for the former to enhance love and sympathy. The latter part of the lesson delves into the nature of Cosmic Consciousness, the 'Dance of Life', and the importance of discipline, particularly Saturnian discipline, in achieving spiritual advancement and making contact on inner planes. It highlights the unity of life and the development of responsibility towards each other. The lesson concludes with an affirmation and announces the advancement to a new course on Tarot Interpretations.

key_concepts.definition: The ability to manipulate life properly, particularly time and environment, through self-discipline, responsibility, and conscious oneness with the Divine (the 'I AM', 'Central God', 'Attah'). It is an indication of spiritual mastery and freedom.
An element of life that must be properly manipulated. Wasting or not understanding time signifies a lack of dominion. Proper use and control of time demonstrate self-discipline and responsibility.

The underlying principle of the universe, representing the interrelated, disciplined, and organized motion of all things, from cells in the body to nebulae in space. It is a manifestation of Cosmic Consciousness and Universal Mind.

An awareness of the unity of life that exists beyond the physical level. It is approached by experiencing unity and becoming more responsible to and for each other. It is associated with Tarot Key 21 and Saturn.
The Hebrew word for 'Thou', representing the Divine, the Central God, the 'I AM' that is at the center of every heart and in all things. It is the ultimate source of freedom and oneness.

The ability to control oneself and one's environment, often associated with Saturn. It is not hateful but a prerequisite for spiritual growth and the development of supersensory powers. It is distinct from repression, which limits love and sympathy.

A key component of dominion, involving the proper use of time, fulfilling obligations, and caring for others. It is seen as a privilege, not a burden, when understood within the context of the interconnectedness of life.

practical_system.description: The text outlines a system for developing supersensory powers, primarily focused on achieving 'dominion' through the mastery of time, discipline, and an internal realization of unity with the Divine ('Attah'). This is framed within the concept of the 'Dance of Life' and Cosmic Consciousness, symbolized by Tarot Key 21. The practice involves cultivating specific attitudes (responsibility, discipline over repression) and engaging in meditative techniques to internalize these principles and connect with higher energies.
tools: Tarot Key 21 ('The World') is presented as a central symbol and tool for understanding Cosmic Consciousness and practicing the associated techniques.
The Qabalistic Tree of Life is referenced for its attributions (Saturn to Key 21, Cosmic Consciousness).
The Hebrew word 'Attah' (Thou) is presented as a powerful mantram for invoking the Divine.
Blue-violet color is used for aura visualization and grounding.
The concept of 'atoms of whirling light' serves as a meditative focus for understanding the energetic composition of reality.
rituals: A visualization technique is described for Tarot Key 21: permeating oneself with blue-violet light, visualizing oneself as the dancing figure, praying to the Divine Androgyne ('Attah'), seeing the body as whirling light, and then practicing a double-spiral visualization moving upwards and downwards, interlacing to immerse oneself in energies and reach for Cosmic Consciousness. This is followed by a meditation on independence from physical dependence and a grounding in blue-violet.
The practice of seeing the 'Dance of Life' in all motion (bird on the wing, eating, walking, driving) and understanding oneself as a center of the Universal All.

relevant_quotes.text: One essential aspect of life which we must learn to manipulate properly is the element of time. If we waste time, or "kill" it, or do not have a correct concept of its importance, we have not yet gained dominion in this area.

To hate our responsibilities, to say, "I wish that I were free" is going backwards. Where we really want to go lies in the opposite direction. Only he is free, who is at one with the I AM, the Central God, the Dancer, the Lord of the Universe, Attah, which means "Thou," that which is at the center of every one of our hearts. When you are consciously at one with That, you are free.
When we say "learn to control" we do not mean repress. Repression limits our ability for love, sympathy or friendly understanding.
What is it that gives us dominion over our environment? The idea of discipline is involved.
Because of the ability to undergo discipline, which is the power of Saturn, and the ability to put aside personality, a contact is made on the inner planes.
This is symbolized in Tarot Key 21 in that Cosmic Consciousness is assigned to it and Saturn is its ruler, showing that love does not consider discipline hateful.

In the state of Cosmic Consciousness time, as we experience it, does not exist. Nevertheless, only as you gain dominion over time on this plane, only as you learn to fulfil your obligations and meet your problems and frustrations with authority, will you be really prepared to manipulate the energies of that state that appears timeless--the state in which past, present, and future are a simultaneous now.

Your body is composed of atoms, of whirling light. These atoms gather together in certain motions to create form. See these atoms of your vehicle as points of light, radiating light in whirling motion. You consist of whirling motion; you are a body of light.
You and the nebulae and the atoms are all in whirling motion, in strict conformity to the cosmic law, which we call the Dance of Life.

Remember that it is the proper attitude that we need to develop more fully, as we practice the technique. Begin by permeating yourself and your aura through and through with blue violet. This is the color of Key 21, the 32nd path on the Tree of Life.
Send up a prayer to what the dancer represents symbolically, to the Divine Androgyne, both male and female, for we are all one being. Call this Universal One, "Thou;" in Hebrew, "Attah."

AFFIRMATION: In all motion, in all movement, I recognize the beautiful Dance of Life. The disciplines and limitations of this world are my good fortune. They are for my growth and lead me ever nearer to the dominion that is my birthright.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to students of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in Tarot, Hermeticism, and the development of psychic and supersensory abilities. It bridges practical occultism with a philosophical understanding of universal laws and divine unity, drawing on Qabalistic concepts (Tree of Life, Saturn, Key 21) and a dynamic, energetic view of existence ('Dance of Life'). The emphasis on discipline and responsibility aligns with classical occult teachings on self-mastery.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of individuals seeking to develop latent psychic or supersensory powers through esoteric study and practice. It is particularly suited for students of Tarot who wish to move beyond mere interpretation to practical application, and for those interested in achieving a higher state of consciousness and dominion over their lives and environments, likely within a structured esoteric or occult training system.
